subject: Programming
title: The Agile Manifesto
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Agile Manifesto.

hook.text: In 2001, seventeen developers met at a ski lodge and wrote a manifesto that changed software forever.

buildup.text: They valued individuals over processes, working software over documentation, and responding to change.

discovery.text: The manifesto didn't prescribe a method. It declared values that any team could adopt their own way.

twist.text: Agile became an industry. Certifications, consultants, and rigid frameworks contradicted its own spirit.

climax.text: The manifesto's principles remain powerful. The commercialization of agile is the real irony.

punchline.text: A manifesto against rigidity became an industry.

quiz.question: What does the Agile Manifesto prioritize?
options: Following a plan over responding to change
